pros: Very supportive environment, very friendly coworkers,  you have freedom to do your works, no micro-managing,  you will feel like you are in team working toward a common goal.
cons: I can’t think of any at this time.

pros: It was a good exprience
cons: less money , No motivation

pros: Nothing to say wrt Pros. It is a sham.
cons:
1) Quality of students is really poor. Most of the students are from India and China who couldn't get into any other university. NPU is a sham/scam and should be investigated more by the Federal Government and accreditation agencies. The setup is worse than a community college where I studied many years ago.

2) Management is extremely poor. Decisions are made and they are not communicated till you hit a roadblock. Then you realize, things were changed and no one told you about it.

3) Students act entitled and ask for unreasonable concessions - end the class 30 min before it is supposed to be over, ask professors to do a makeup midterm because they forgot to study, change the grade even when they fail. List goes on and on.

review_title: A sham that USCIS needs to crack down on
pros:
They physically exist! 
There are actually 4 buildings on the 'campus'.
cons: This is a typical money making scam under the guise of a 'university'. Able to trick low-end foreign students to join because they dont have the grades to get admitted anywhere else. The accreditation levels barely meet the minimum requirements, and good companies avoid hiring from here. Beyond that, looks good! :)

pros: Professor is experienced, and clearly assigned each section of work to me after class.  Flexible working hours to help students.
cons: There should be specific area for teaching assistant during working hours, so students can meet their assistant or ask questions.

pros: Flexible time. You can choose your preferred section matching your schedule. If you just want some extra income, it's a perfect place to go.
cons: Students with basis below average. Need to build their knowledge from scratch. The campus can barely help you with materials and syllabus.

pros: It is flextime and can force to improve your professional knowledge since the students always have various questions of learning.
cons: The pay rate is not very well and they do not provide any benefit for teaching assistant. There are too many students in a class.

job_title: IT Student Assistant in Fremont, CA
pros: Sometimes its a relaxing environment.
cons:
They split your hours in a way that makes you stay there for longer but unable to go home.
I got paid for 2 hours once but it was separated with 2 hours of "break" so I ended staying at the school for 6 hours even tho they only payed me for 2.

Its not really a career building place if your looking to get your foot into being really anything. If you're expecting them to teach you skills you're out of luck.

pros: Best place to study master's and can learn many things from professor as most of them have industrial experience.
cons: This school  students who made up mostly of international students from India and China, that by itself is not bad, but many of the students that I have worked with do not work well in a team setting.

review_title: NPU is a school that places too much focus on the students at the expense of its staff.
pros: Talented professors, courteous staff and some good students.
cons: Extreme low salaries. No pay raises in a long time.  Staff are not empowered to make any decisions.  Rules are handed down from the top without much process or thoughts.

cons: Services are not improving. Remains same over the years. IT department is in bad shape.
